comments.body:
Hi, xuchao:
I have a question about this.
In patch(https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/43060/commits/94c525ade2aee394bc92238b3c3aac4e9a4bfefe),  I modified file staging/src/k8s.io/apiserver/pkg/server/options/etcd.go 
When I run "git commit" I get an errorï¼š
Found flags in golang files not in the list of known flags. Please add these to hack/verify-flags/known-flags.txt
storage-backend

I want to know is this expected?
This pr doesn't cause that. It's a check run by hack/verify-flags-underscore.py. Please follow the instruction in the error to add the flag to known-flags.txt
Is it likely that this will continue to expand?
Not by me...   I ran out of things that could cut down the whitelist significantly.  But anyone who looks at the exceptions list might find more ideas....

comments.body: Just to be certain, this is fine to operate on individual lines because we're matching explicit flag names and they shouldn't split across lines anyways?
correct, i can probably change it to use findall as well.
nah, since the 'exceptions' are per line and flag names can't span lines, I'm not going to change this bit and it should be fine.
